env.template:
# Environment Setup

# Verify Node.js version (VS Code requires Node.js 20.18.1+)
node --version

# Install dependencies
npm install

# See CONTRIBUTING.md for detailed setup instructions
# https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#prerequisites

docker.template:
# Docker Setup

# Build VS Code in Docker container
docker build -t vscode-dev .

# Run VS Code development environment
docker run -it vscode-dev

# Note: See CONTRIBUTING.md for Docker-specific requirements
# https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute

wsl.template:
# WSL Setup Notes

# VS Code development on Windows Subsystem for Linux
# Ensure you're running in WSL, not Windows CMD/PowerShell

# Install Node.js (if not already installed)
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_20.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt-get install -y nodejs

# Verify installation
node --version
npm --version

# See CONTRIBUTING.md for WSL-specific notes
# https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute

lint.template:
# Linting Workflow

# Run ESLint checks
npm run eslint

# Run stylelint checks
npm run stylelint

# Run all linting (via hygiene)
npm run hygiene

# See CONTRIBUTING.md for linting guidelines
# https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute

test.template:
# Running Tests

# Run browser tests
npm run test-browser

# Run Node.js tests
npm run test-node

# Run extension tests
npm run test-extension

# See CONTRIBUTING.md for testing guidelines
# https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute

build.template:
# Build Workflow

# Compile TypeScript
npm run compile

# Watch mode (auto-recompile on changes)
npm run watch

# Launch VS Code in development mode
.\scripts\code.bat  # Windows
./scripts/code.sh   # Linux/macOS

# See CONTRIBUTING.md for build instructions
# https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute
